meanings.definition: The ability to store electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The capacitances of the battery allowed it to hold a lot of energy.
meanings.sent2: The capacitances of the power bank determine how long it can charge your phone.
meanings.sent3: The capacitances of the outlet were so high that it seemed to never run out of power.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had capacitances like a well-charged battery, ready to tackle any problem.
meanings.sent5: The capacitances of the lightning bolt were so intense that it lit up the entire sky.

meanings.definition: The measure of a capacitor's ability to store charge.
meanings.sent1: The technician checked the capacitances of the capacitor to ensure it was functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: The capacitances of the new capacitor were higher than expected, providing better performance.
meanings.sent3: The capacitances of the capacitor were so precise that it could store just the right amount of charge.
meanings.sent4: His memory had capacitances like a capacitor, holding onto important details for a long time.
meanings.sent5: The capacitances of the capacitor were like a reservoir, ready to release energy when needed.

meanings.definition: The total charge that can be stored in a capacitor.
meanings.sent1: The capacitances of the capacitor were crucial for powering the device.
meanings.sent2: The capacitances of the capacitor determined how much energy it could hold.
meanings.sent3: The capacitances of the capacitor were so full that it seemed to glow with stored charge.
meanings.sent4: Her heart had capacitances like a capacitor, holding onto love and memories.
meanings.sent5: The capacitances of the capacitor were like a treasure chest, full of electric potential.
